text: Great service and response time.  Kept me informed of when they were coming and were right on time.  Professional service from the office personnel and Drew, our plumber, was very thorough and professional.  Highly recommend this company.  Thanks Drew!!

text: Outstanding young man owns the company & is very conscientious about his work...honesty & integrity is important to Bret.  He came immediately to help me during a bit of a crisis, made the repair quickly & explained the issue thoroughly.  And in my opinion,  for a very good price.  I highly recommend calling 9-1 Plumb for any issues.

name: Glen Deal
text:
I called 9-1 Plumb on a Tuesday and made an after hours appointment for Thursday (all they had available at the time). I told the "dispatcher" Renee (sp?) that I had a water meter ripped out of the ground by Hurricane Sally and that I needed new meter re-installed in ground, hooked and entire new line ran to house. Requested that if anything opened up between Tuesday and Thursday to notify me.

Thursday morning Brent contacted me and said he would scope out the job and call me back. Within 15 minutes he called with a description and plan to solve the issue and that his crew (Drew and Nolan) could be onsite within an hour or so and complete the entire job by end of day.

Drew and Nolan arrived as scheduled with all necessary equipment (to include trencher) to complete the job and restore services to my home.

All of the members of 9-1 Plumb, Brent, Drew, Nolan and Renee were exceptionally professional, friendly, timely and most of all - customer service oriented.

I couldn't have asked for better.

We very much appreciate their work and most highly recommend them!!!! They will be my first call for any future issues!!!!

name: Mitch Pinkston
text:
If you are looking for a fair, honest, and professional plumber, call 9-1 Plumb.

Brent, the master plumber, explains every step of the repair process, and he ensures that the job is done in a timely fashion.  Due to poor pipes used by the homebuilder 10 years ago, our house experienced multiple leaks last fall.  Brent responded within a couple of hours of our call and was able to locate and repair the issues.  Eventually, 9-1 Plumb completed a re-pipe of our house.  We received multiple bids, and they completed the re-pipe in a quick and clean manner while also being the most cost-effective option for me.

This week our original grinder pump stopped working when it met its life expectancy (10 years).  Brent thoroughly checked every part of the grinder pump system to try to find the least costly repair.  Unfortunately, the pump was shot and a replacement was needed.  Brent was able to have a new pump and assembly installed the very next day.

I will call Brent at 9-1 Plumb for all of my plumbing needs.

The staff at 9-1 Plumb

name: David Chew
text: We had a clogged toilet drain in our master bath. It has been backing up about once a month for a while. These guys came in and got to work right away. They did not stop until the drain was clear. They went through the toilet first, then the sink, then the shower, and then back through the toilet, and then up through the clean out located on the outside of the house. After all of that they went back to their office and pick up the "BIG" machine. Once they got back they ran it once through the toilet drain where it ran into the clog and cut through the major clog and clearing the pipe. We watched at the outside clean out as the nasty clog pushed on through and out to the sewer. Then we saw nothing but clear water after that. No problems since then.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us such a positive review.  We understand our customers concerns and try to take care of them in a professional and timely manner.  We are here if you need us.

name: Samantha Pinkston
text: I can't say enough good things about Brent and D.  I called 9-1 Plumb when we had water coming up through our hardwood floor. The dispatcher initially said they wouldn't be able to get to us until the next day, but called when they had an opening later in the day since I had mentioned I wanted same day. We had a different plumber out earlier who told us at best we were going to need a costly repair or at worst would need to redo the plumbing in the entire house.  When the source of the leak wasn't obvious, Brent was thorough in figuring out what was actually leaking and was able to do the repair easily and for a very reasonable price. 9-1-Plumb saved us thousands of dollars. I highly recommend and will use them for all our future plumbing needs.

name: Georgia Brown
text: I would highly recommend this company!! I had what I thought was a leaking water heater in my rental house. Water was getting under the laminate flooring. I called Doug after hours. He answered promptly and answered all my questions and said he could come the next day. My renter and I had shut off and drained the water heater. He was there at the time he promised with his co worker Jeff.  They discovered I actually had a slab leak! He gave me a quote that was much less than I expected and said they could start the next day. Brent and Jake came the next morning on time and ready to work. They worked all day with only a short break. They were courteous and professional and also very neat and respectful and careful not to disturb my renter's personal belongings. The job was a 2 day job and they came first thing the next morning to complete their work and worked this day until they finished without taking a break. They showed and explained to me everything they had done. You could hardly tell there had been any work done at all, everything was so clean!! Sorry to write a book, but having these guys do this job made a very stressful situation much less so!! I can't praise them enough and they will definitely get my business in the future!!  Georgia B.  Fairhope, Al

Why waste my time and money....just tell your customers from beginning that 9 1 plumb  has no experience with tankless water heater....instead of robbing customers for an easy buck....i was supposed to here back from him shortly....its been 2 weeks.....unprofessional....inexperienced and a rip off....

name: Marissa Thetford
text:
We've used Doug and his team twice and have had a great experience both times.

The first time he repaired a leak in the laundry room behind our washer which caused flooding into our kitchen. He responded quickly, after hours (at night on a weekend), and dina great job.

Today we called on him again to install a garbage disposal in our kitchen and check a leak behind our master bathroom toilet. The disposal was easy, but the bathroom was a bit trickier since he didn't know what he would find behind the wall. He walked me through the steps he was taking and provided a price range based on what he might find once he got started which was helpful. (That way we knew what the high end might be if damage was extensive or the repair was more complex than anticipated.) Thankfully, it wasn't as bad as it could have been and itwas easily fixed in one visit.

The 9-1 team is on time, professional, and affordable. Doug and his team were also very clean while working on the repairs which was much appreciated. I'd strongly reccomend the 9-1 team to anyone in the area looking for a reliable plumbing team.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your recommendation! We strive to offer quality professional plumbing work. We are pleased that were able to provide these services to you and will be there if needed again!!

name: Peeka T.
text: This store looked great! My sis and I had a great time walking around looking at all the treasures that Home Goods has to offer. Its literally a treasure hunt. To the untrained eye, some items may look like they are priced averagely, but to those of us that understand quality, this is where we go first before heading out to over priced department stores. One could browse this store for hours. The employees do a great job keeping this Home Goods location organized. There are plenty of good finds for all ages.

text: Such cute things, organized, and very clean. It's impressive they're able to keep so much so well organized when similar stores can't seem to keep a single shelf straight. Always a positive experience.

name: Elisha-Hope Weaver
text:
The locations observes Covid safety measures.

Location currently has a good select of inventory. Staff seems to replenish inventory as it becomes available. *Friendly suggestion* if you see something you like, BUY IT THEN! (Most inventory doesn't last long and is RARELY duplicated)

Location is neat and orderly, however navigation in the aisles can become congested if directional floor signage not observed.

Staff is friendly, helpful and professional.

Overall, it was a pleasant shopping experience.

text: Store was somewhat clean and the staff was nice. The aisles were free of debris with the exception of unpacked boxes. This is one of the larger Dollar Tree stores and offers more items than most although shelves were not full. A plus is service animals are welcomed. There is a large refrigerator/freezer section that offers a variety of items from eggs and waffles to frozen flounder filets. Wait time was minimal for check out and employees were helpful.

name: Breanicia Turner
text: Not only was I racially profiled a couple months back by an employee named India. India who is always on her phone ringing up customers, snarling at people she doesn't like, and just being plain rude. Tonight I went in and asked where I could find a green polo shirt bc I planned on being India for Halloween to make light of a situation that really hurt my feelings. To be followed around a store bc of the color of my skin. So to make matters worse after asking Carrie the manager where I could find a polo she told me the thrift store. So then I told her I was going to be India . Carrie was furious. She berated me and told me and all the other customers in the store it was their job to follow people that are stealing around dollar tree as if I was stealing . She yelled that India was doing her job and that it didn't matter which color the person was. Making it seem as if I am a thief. I'm in total disbelief bc I've known Carrie the manager for years. But the way she acted and talked to me tonight amongst other shoppers was ridiculous, mentally scarring, and just plain bad for business. I literally shop in dollar tree every single day. But this could all be changed very soon . Thanks to Carrie having a bad day. Then to make the situation my worst yet this year. I was apologizing to the cashier ringing me up telling her I knew the objectives of their job bc I was offered a management position about a year ago and had a application for the job in my car . Carrie the manager walks out and tells me to shut up and that the conversation is basically over. I said Carrie I was not talking to you I was speakkng to the cashier. I think it's sad when a person brings their personal life to work. I know Carrie has problems at home. So I told her I didn't know what she bad going on but I knew this wasn't her . Bottom line I won't be back to filbert ferry dollar tree for a while.

text: The cooking classes are a great date night; culinary education mixed with amazing food and knowledgeable people.

name: Lelia Wissert
text: My daughter and I took a class, Celebration of New Orleans. It was fun, Chef Steven was great and his helper was too. The facilities were really nice. We made gumbo, shrimp and grits and bananas foster. My disappointment was the tomatoes in the gumbo, it turned the gumbo into a creole dish. Corporate needs to let the Chef’s cook dishes that are regional and not from some far away place.  We lived in Louisiana for many years and never had gumbo that was red.  Be sure to try a class!!

name: Vicki Yackel
text: Absolutely love this store, their products and the staff!  Chef Tenita is awesome!  Can't wait until classes begin again!

name: O P
text: Expert and honest opinion, going out of sale get it while you can.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: I was able to enter freely and see a 'cook's dream' and all I could do was add the cost and try to place in my budget to return for purchases.

name: Brittany Ward
text: Recently took a class here, and it was way too crowded - 14 people plus 3 chefs. Their kitchen is not big enough to accommodate that many people to have a comfortable experience. It was 4 people to a 3 person station. For the price of $70+ per person, you would expect more and more hands-on. Overall, the chefs were great. Really hate they are limited to a set, very basic recipe from corporate. Also, their stove wasn’t working properly. All groups were cooking at different temps for different amounts of time, which messed up some people’s food.

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
This store is pretty cool. It's like Bed Bath & Beyond, but just the Beyond part and on steroids at that! All things kitchen can pretty much be found here. Depending on what you're used to, you might consider it on the pricey side, but that comes along with the quality/brands they sell here. I've walked through this store and seen items I literally had no clue existed. Staff has been completely friendly and helpful in my experience. Especially with the nice array of FANCY coffee machines that will gladly dispense samples for you.

Also, toward the back of the store they have a kitchen setup for group cooking classes. Again, imo on the pricey side but check the website because they sometimes have sales! The class we attended was nothing short of spectacular! The teacher was great, the format of cooking in teams worked well and ALL of the food we prepared in this particular class was amazing! So happy that we got to bring the recipes home to try them out on our own (and maybe add our own spin to things)!

Come check the store out for yourself, even if just to simply window shop!

name: Cyrus Patel
text: I think everyone who is into cooking should do a cooking class here. My girlfriend and I have done two. One with Chef Rodney (scallops, rice, salad, and a souffles) and one with Chef Steven (salmon, mashed potatoes, salad, and a creme brulee). Both times we had so much fun. They are expensive but totally worth it. We will definitely be doing more cooking classes.

name: Bonnie Philips
text:
SHOCKED AND SADDENED by the other reviews! :(
I have always had amazing experiences in this store. The employees are helpful, efficient, and care about the costumers and the merchandise. I love their selection especially the Pearl dinnerware collection, which the staff helped me piece together throughout the years as the collection grew. Grateful to have this Sur la Table in Birmingham!!

name: Krissi Harpel
text: All the reviews were great so I was excited to get started with this company.  Their representative came to the house and brought a contractor, I was told it would take about a week to generate an estimate of materials.  During that week I sent some colors I liked and a couple of questions and I was not getting any response from the designer .  Once the week was up I sent an email to the designer and told her I needed someone who was going to be responsive to emails .  She immediately responded saying that she could not get my cabinets to meet our timeline and I would have to find someone else ...which if she had paid attention I had asked for an estimate on painting and replacing .  I then left a message for someone from management. to call me and got no response.  Very very disappointing

resp.text: I spoke with Krissi and explained a few items to her concerning her project and attempted to assist her with her project even though Coastal is not performing the project.  Hopefully this will help.  We do not paint cabinets and recommend under normal conditions that this not be done.  Typically, a paint job will have to repeated in the near term due to underlying issues with cabinets themselves.

name: Hilton Perry
text: For many months my wife and I  have wanted to remodel our bath but finding some one that was knowledgeable and and responsive was impossible and had almost given up. A friend told us to call  Coastal Kitchen & Bath and with in just a few days we were set up to meet and go over what we wanted and measure. The next week we were picking out the flooring, cabinets and fixtures we wanted. Today we have the bath that we had visioned for moths. Very responsive and courteous.

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  It can be amazing what a kitchen remodel can do for the appearance of your home and your piece of mind.

name: Chelsie Sotero
text: I have had the pleasure of working with Jill here and she is a delight! This company should be proud to have her as an employee. She is very knowledgeable, helpful and very friendly. I will tell everyone I know to make sure to stop in!!!

resp.text: you're going to love your new mud room

name: me to you
text:
The lady, Jill, was very helpful.  If you go there you have to order what you see on display.  Ordering means a 3 or 4 week delay.  They have a variety of everything related to the bathroom.  My apologies because I did not take photos.

My contractor wants it yesterday. Seems the stuff is never there fast enough for them. They want to go to Lowe's, pick it up, and install it the same day.

resp.text: Thanks for the opportunity.  We do not keep cabinets in stock since there are so many options, sizes and colors.  Unfortunately, contractors can experience delays and then want everything yesterday, like you said.

name: Alla Nikitina
text: Out of business

resp.text: Actually, we are not out of business.  We have a new location that we are working on opening up after the Hurricane Sally destruction to our old building but we have been working from remote locations since Sally.  Our website, Facebook page, Pinterest, Google My Business page, etc. all reflect we are open for business and have been open for business.  Our phone number is active as well so feel free to contact us if you have a project you are interested in us quoting for you.  251-943-5358.

name: ted croft
text: They dont stand behind their products! Bought a marble vanity top and they installed two sinks (undermount) and the silicone bled through to the surface of the top and stained it where the silicone was applied for the sinks. The top is ruined! After sending pics Mike told me to call the manufacturer of the silicone to get it fixed or remedied. What terrible customer service. Good thing he sold the company!

resp.text: Ted is correct, the business has been sold to the owner of Folkers Window Company.  The marble vanity top Ted purchased was a old remnant from the warehouse and was "sold as is" for a very cheap price.  Unfortunately with remnants and very low prices, these things happen.  This was communicated to the customer at the time of the sale.  The best way to avoid issues with products and expired warranties is to purchase new products instead of remnants.

resp.text: Thanks for the business and the review.  No, we are not the cheapest because as you said "good products".  We do not sell junk and we use professional installers and not sub contractors.  In addition, we use stainless steel fasteners, high grade caulks, etc. all which lead to a higher price and a higher quality installation.  Thus, we will typically not be the cheapest...but we're the best.

text: This is a great store with excellent customer service. I needed the new Kohler Bellera faucet (K-560 with Docknetik and Sweep spray) and kohler chose not to change model numbers so they could unload remaining inventory. This particular faucet is not available online or lowe's/home depot. The store manager understood exactly what I wanted, ordered exactly what I wanted, walked me through the installation, and was incredibly knowledgable/helpful. He also took the time to help me troubleshoot a shutoff valve problem on another sink. Kohler makes a great product, the faucet is awesome, and this is the place to purchase. Great staff, local business, will definitely use again.

name: notthebeesxoxo
text: The people are amazing, always nice, the store is always organized without any issues. But within the last few months, their ac has been broken and they will not fix it. They are forcing their employees to work in a building that is hotter than 90° and only giving them little fans to cool them off. Within 5 mins of being in the store, I was sweating. I am here all the time and have noticed over months that nothing is being done. Until you guys fix your air and prove to your employees that you care about them and their health, I won't be back. And I will make sure the many people I know who live in this area know how your employees are treated. This is disgusting. Wrong. Unethical. I could go on. What's crazy is they have 3 signs up saying they need managers, stockers and cashier's. I WONDER WHY. Paying employees $7.25 to stand in 90° weather. Despicable!!!

name: Anna Beavers
text:
We live right around the corner from this Dollar Tree.
We are remodeling our home ourselves and therefore we visit the store several times a week. Every employee knows our names and they are quick to help us out in any way possible.
But it's not just us, every employee always has a smile for every customer, and they go out of their way to help find something that a customer may be looking for.
They should all get an A + for customer service and knowledge of their store.

I have been to other Dollar Tree stores, and I was disappointed in the customer service, as there was none. The employees were standing around, obviously supposed to be working, and after standing in line for several minutes, with no acknowledgement from any employee, I asked to be checked out, and the MANAGER sighed and acted like she was doing me a favor by ringing me up.
As insulting as that was, there was an employee leaning on the customer side of the register, and he had a Mountain Dew, and she rang him up before me. He realized that he didn't have any money, and the MANAGER was about to void it out, and I smiled and said," I'll pay for it."
Needless to say, I will never go back to the Pelham Dollar Tree again.

I pointed that out to say this, you will NEVER find employees hanging around at the Valleydale store. If they are at work, they are working.
If they are stocking the aisles and they notice a line forming, someone will run and open another register.
After being in the retail sales business for over 30 years, I can honestly say that I would hire your entire team.

name: Villeta Pinson
text: The Dollar Tree in Hoover Alabama is awesome! It is kept neat and clean! When there is a line they quickly opened up a second register.

name: Paula Jo Taylor
text: How can you expect your employees and customers to be in that store with no heat???  Ridiculous!!

name: Bill Tiemann
text: Great place for great deals. Everything's a dollar. What more could you want? And... there are some name brand products.

name: Amy McLeod
text: Love coming here for things that usually cost way too much for things my girls will only wear a short time (like cute headbands)! 😄

name: Jessica Wilson
text: Pretty good Dollar Tree... They sometimes run out of supply but is good on restock

name: Rick Smith
text: This has nothing to do with the employees...The folks that work here are amazing  I was in this location for about 30 minutes and not 10 minutes I had sweat running down my forehead...this company makes a lot of money, you would think they could keep there employees for sweating to death...I over heard at least 6 complaints from other customers...

name: terrell haley
text: Great staff and has a lot of stuff just wish it had frozen fooda

name: scott durden
text: Very clean and employees always very polite

name: Karen McDaniel
text: Shop here all the time. Great employees

name: Steven Hughes
text: Not bad. No frozen section.

name: Jacob Roberts
text: Great place to find party stuff for cheap!

name: Lynnea Mae Cramer
text: Everything is a dollar. Friendly associates,neat and clean
